titleStmt.title: A Dialogue betwixt a horse of warre, and a mill-horse; wherein the content and safety of an humble and painfull life, is preferred above all the noyse, the tumults, and trophies of the warre. Full of harmelesse mirth, and variety.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Bernard Alsop, and published according to order,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
